block.p: Christina von Riesenfelder, the daughter of Elizabeth and Carl von Riesenfelder of Manchester, Vt., was married yesterday to Kevin Michael Roe, a son of Joan Ellen Roe and Dr. Patrick A. Roe of Fox Point, Wis. The Rev. Warren Sazama performed the ceremony at Sacred Heart St. Francis de Sales Roman Catholic Church in Bennington, Vt.

The bride, 29, is a vice president for institutional marketing and client servicing at Lazard Freres, the investment bank in New York. She graduated from Johns Hopkins University. Her father, a retired senior vice president for MasterCard International, worked in Paris as its general manager for Africa and the Middle East.

Christina von Riesenfelder, the daughter of Elizabeth and Carl von Riesenfelder of Manchester, Vt., was married yesterday to Kevin Michael Roe, a son of Joan Ellen Roe and Dr. Patrick A. Roe of Fox Point, Wis. The Rev. Warren Sazama performed the ceremony at Sacred Heart St. Francis de Sales Roman Catholic Church in Bennington, Vt.

The bride, 29, is a vice president for institutional marketing and client servicing at Lazard Freres, the investment bank in New York. She graduated from Johns Hopkins University. Her father, a retired senior vice president for MasterCard International, worked in Paris as its general manager for Africa and the Middle East.

The bridegroom, 32, is a senior telecommunications analyst in New York for ABN AMRO, the Dutch bank. He graduated from the University of Wisconsin at Madison and received an M.B.A. degree from Georgetown University. His father practices internal medicine in Milwaukee and is also an associate clinical professor of medicine at the Medical College of Wisconsin.
